body:
Did you try Share annotations across all users"?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/544269/72195532-1c02d180-3456-11ea-8b2f-763b810f1406.png)
@icoxfog417 yes, i've set this option when creating the project.

@Slyne Thank you for reporting, please help me to clarify your problem.

* You checked "Share annotations across all users" then ...
  * You can't "watch" any annotations by other users?
  * You can't "edit" any annotations by other users?
  * You can't "control" the role of other annotators for editing/watching?

Yes, I checked "share annotations across all users" and also set collaborative annotation in admin page.
I can watch annotations by other users.
I can't edit any annotations by other users.
I'm not sure where to control the role.  I give all the permissions to all users on the admin page but it still doesn't work.

@Slyne Thank you for the clarification. We arrange the relation between the feature to share the annotation and the feature to control the authority to it (read/write).

|         | read                                     | write       |
|---------|------------------------------------------|-------------|
| private | (default)                                  | (default)     |
| share   | "Share annotations across all users" now | **missing** |

issue.title: Simultaneous annotation by multiple users

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hello all!

I have a project with a dataset of about 12k phrases and about 20 different labels

This dataset was being annotated by 18 people at the same time. Well, when the people starts to label de phrases the annotations are being duplicated. We have tested all the configurations posibilities of the project, checking and unchecking the "Concurrence annotations" and "Randomize order" and in all cases the annotations are being duplicated. This means that in all cases the users are receiving like "Undone" phrases that are already annotated even if has the "Undone" filter selected

What is the right configuration for annotating a dataset concurrently between many users avoiding duplicities?
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   When you install doccano: 2 months ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc):  Docker compose from github source

issue.title: Allow the annotation approver to edit/remove existing annotations

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behavior
---------
I have set couple of users as `annotation_approver` for sequence labeling. However, when an approver starts reviewing annotations, they cannot see what tags other users have created (even the admin cannot see) by default. They have to press the  button first and only then annotations from other users are visible. But now even though they can see the annotations after pressing , they cannot delete them, shows 403 error (only admins can delete annotations).

Edit: I have tried to add individual labeling permissions from the `admin page > users > user page`, still no change

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: MacOS Mojave
*   Python Version Used: 3
*   When you install doccano: April 8 (a guess)
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker

body: I think this should be fixed with my implementation of #703 if it gets approved. After that annotation approvers can edit/remove other annotations that were made by annotators.

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote  related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show  if someone upvote, and  means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

issue.title: Annotators should have permission to change/add/delete tags if given in Django

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
Approvers already have it, but annotators sometimes are asked to tag a pre-tagged (not reliable) document and propose a right tagged document.

This could be a Project constraint like "Can annotators remove other annotator tags?".

I guess annotators are same level, so they can edit other annotation and vice-versa. What they can't do is edit already approved docs.

body: I guess annotator should be able to edit other annotators tags only if document was not approved.

To make my mind clear:

- If `share annotation` is not checked:
  - all the roles can't view other's annotations.
- If `share annotation` is checked:
  - all the roles can view other's annotations.
  - `project_admin` and `annotation_approver` can edit/delete other's annotations.
  - `annotator` cannot edit/delete other's annotations.

Ideal situation:
- If `share annotation` is not checked, all the roles can view/edit/delete only their own annotations.
- If `share annotation` is checked, all the roles can view/edit/delete other's annotations.
- (I don't think `annotation approver` is allowed to annotate. we need to design roles and their permissions more clearly.)

Solution:
- Make `permission_classes` in `AnnotationDetail` dependent on `share annotation` option.
- If `share annotation` is not checked, `permission_classes` has `[IsAuthenticated & IsProjectAdmin & IsOwnAnnotation]`.
- If `share annotation` is checked, `permission_classes` has `[IsAuthenticated & IsInProjectOrAdmin]`.

The way:
- overwrite `get_permissions` method.

```
class AnnotationDetail(generics.RetrieveUpdateDestroyAPIView):
    lookup_url_kwarg = 'annotation_id'
    # permission_classes = [IsAuthenticated & IsInProjectOrAdmin]
    swagger_schema = None

    def get_permissions(self):
        project = get_object_or_404(Project, pk=self.kwargs['project_id'])
        if project.collaborative_annotation:
            self.permission_classes = [IsAuthenticated & IsInProjectOrAdmin]
        else:
            self.permission_classes = [IsAuthenticated & IsInProjectOrAdmin & IsOwnAnnotation]
        return super().get_permissions()
```

issue.title: Allow annotator to update/delete other's annotations

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Now, if `share annotation` option is checked, all the roles can view/delete/update other's annotations.
Not realtime.

closes #866
